findings.title: Potential unauthorized script upgrade
findings.description: The smart contract may allow an unauthorized user to upgrade the script, potentially leading to security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: onlyOwner vulnerability in setTradingStatus function
findings.description: The smart contract owner has the privilege to change the trading status, which can impose extraordinary transaction fees and potentially create a functional vulnerability.

findings.title: onlyOwner vulnerability in excludeFromReward function
findings.description: The excludeFromReward function has an onlyOwner vulnerability.

findings.title: onlyOwner vulnerability in includeInReward function
findings.description: The includeInReward function has an onlyOwner access control vulnerability.

findings.title: onlyOwner vulnerability in excludeFromFee function
findings.description: The onlyOwner modifier allows only the contract owner to call the excludeFromFee function, which may lead to unauthorized access or manipulation.

findings.title: onlyOwner vulnerability in includeInFee function
findings.description: Smart contract owner can change transaction fees. This function module can be used to impose extraordinary transaction fees. No arbitrary limit set.

findings.title: onlyOwner vulnerability in setTaxes function
findings.description: The setTaxes function has an onlyOwner vulnerability, allowing the contract owner to unilaterally change tax settings.

findings.title: onlyOwner vulnerability in setSellTaxes function
findings.description: The setSellTaxes function has an onlyOwner vulnerability, allowing the contract owner to change transaction fees without any arbitrary limit.
